title: Hero to Mark its Entry in Mexico, Argentina and Nigeria
text: Hero to Mark its Entry in Mexico, Argentina and Nigeria 23rd, Oct 2015 3:56 PM View: 57 0 Hero MotoCorp has recently announced its plans to enter new markets in three countries namely Argentina, Mexico and Nigeria . Despite getting separated from Honda , the former is doing quite well in the two-wheeler industry. Presently, it enjoys 46% market share in the two-wheeler segment and it caters to the customers of 24 countries that include the likes of Sri Lanka, Bangladesh, Nepal, Egypt, Turkey, Colombia, Peru and Ecuador. The brand had also set up its first ever production plant outside India located in Villa Rica, Colombia. The company is expanding its operations globally and growing enormously with each passing day. Also Read: Hero MotoCorp Production Plant in Colombia In Colombia, Hero had acquired 17 acres of land for setting up a plant that currently produces 3,000 units monthly. The company has invested a total of 70 Million USD, which equates to around INR 453 Crores and plans to stretch the production figure to 4000 units per month. It also owns some assembly plants in East Africa, located at Kenya, Tanzania and Uganda that operate under partnership with the local distributors over there. Details on: Hero MotoCorp Bikes in India If reports are to be believed, the entity is planning to rule the market in 50 countries alongside establishing more than 20 assembly units all over the world by 2020. In terms of sales, it is planning a hike of 25% that translates to 2.5 Lakh units this year as opposed to the sales of 2 Lakh units last year. However, owing to its aggressive strategy of ruling the international market, it hasn't been able to focus on the domestic sales. From April to September last year, the sales were 53,64,391 which came down to 55,91,328 units for the same duration this year. The automobile giant is reportedly working on studying the local market closely and in order to revive soon.
